result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Romello R Salinas

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($200.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $200.00

Defendant Romello R Salinas not in court.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case set for calendar call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered signature bond forfeited.

Defendant Romello R Salinas not in court.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for calendar call.  Court was concerned that a PD has not been appointed and ordered the matter adjourned.  Clerk to contact the SPD office.
Calendar call scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Romello R Salinas not in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom. Defendant was previously checked in on zoom but left. Defendant is eligible for public defender but no attorney has been appointed yet.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 01.  Calendar call scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07/09/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Romello R Salinas in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-7-2022 @1:30p
